segments.text: This entire scene makes me feel a bit exasperated, honestly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can an adult be so utterly disconnected from her immediate surroundings?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's not just a minor spill; it's a full-blown flood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sheer volume of water is incredible to think about.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those children, while clever, are putting themselves in real danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a pity that common sense seems to have taken a holiday here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to shout at them all to stop.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The waste of water is also quite disheartening to see.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Everything looks like it's on the verge of collapsing or breaking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This domestic tranquility is such a facade.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone intervenes before things get truly chaotic.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's just a constant string of bad decisions and missed observations.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Such a frustrating sequence of events in a simple kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR
